snippet: Suicide bombers struck in busy areas of Herat and Helmand on Tuesday, killing as many 18 people, according to local police officials.
abstract: Suicide bombers strike in western and southern Afghanistan, killing 16 people, in a further sign that the insurgents' spring offensive is under way; Taliban spokesman claims responsibility for the attack.

byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Suicide bombers struck in busy areas of Herat and Helmand on Tuesday, killing as many 18 people, according to local police officials.

headline.main: Attacks Attest to Afghan Insurgents’ Spring Offensive
headline.print_headline: Attacks Attest to Afghan Insurgents’ Spring Offensive
